name: Maldo's Education in School 3D
description:
1/3 of all the homes with a water source are in Sardinia, a small state bordering Italy. When you enter the castle for the first time, you'll find that at one point, you'll be standing right next to a fountain and swimming in the water. However, if you're wearing clothes that cover your entire body in clothes that are visible to the world, the only objects visible on your body are the clothes you're wearing, which you can't swim through, and the water that you're standing on.

2. Waterfall (Sassafrannán)

2,000-2,500 feet long and 5 feet wide, the water falls up into the mountains to a waterfall on a small river in Sassafrénán, on the southern tip of the island of Sardinia (near the border with Italy). You'll arrive at this waterfall from a small boat you've built yourself on the beach.

3. River-Dike (Sardinian-Nova Truglia)

This dike is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site, because it is the oldest continuous river in Sardinia and it has been named this since 1884. A great deal of the water falls from its banks into an island located at the bottom; there are many different names for this
